intro: Pinus sylvestris f. macrocarpa, commonly known as the Scots pine giant variant, is a subspecies of the Scots pine native to northern Europe. It is characterized by its larger, more robust cones and longer needles compared to the typical Scots pine. The plant exhibits a coniferous growth habit, with tall, straight trunks and a broad, pyramidal crown. Its foliage consists of needle-like leaves that are typically 5–10 cm long, arranged in pairs. This subspecies is adapted to grow in a variety of soil types and is often found in forested areas across its native range.
